The urlLink offending statue , of a sleeping panther, struck Ms. Castillo as too paganistically feline, and therefore "sinister," and she recommended a statue of something else, such as a steer. urlLink Stockholm, Sweden AP -- It's buttered sole -- but definitely not of the seafood variety. A couple hiking in the mountains of far northern Sweden found 70 pairs of shoes, all filled with butter. Officials have no idea who put the shoes there, or why. A provincial spokesman says the buttered footwear ranges from sneakers to boots. There are even butter-filled high heels and tap shoes. Each contains about a pound of butter. The province spokesman says they'd like to catch the person who did it and make them clean it up. He says it's going to create quite a mess when the butter starts to spoil. Officials say they'll wait for snow, so they can get a snowmobile into the area. Aliens? :)

OK, so my friend Tricia was reading this Blog and said "What's all this about the Buckeyes and the BCS? What is it?" I said "Tricia, you're such a girl!" :) So, I'm wondering, does everyone know what the BCS is and what I'm talking about? Let me give a few details and explanations just in case... So, it's all about College Football! The NCAA (National Collegiate Athletic Association), the Ohio State Buckeyes and the BCS (Bowl Championship Series). I love College Football. Now, don't get me wrong, I'm not a Superfan, I just enjoy watching it, and even more so when the Buckeyes are doing well. OSU is not my Alma Mater (I graduated from Kent State University, not much to watch in college football), but since I am from Ohio, I am by natural rights a Buckeye. urlLink Article from the NCAA News - includes a history of the BCS. So, long story short....Before the BCS there was never (or very rarely) a championship game. There would be a #1 team and a #2 team in the polls, but these 2 teams would not pair off and play each other. Therefore leaving an inconclusive National Champion. That's no way to end the season, who's to know what would happen if these top 2 teams would play? So the BCS guarantees that the top 2 teams will play each other in that years Championship bowl. Make sense? Another reason that the BCS was started was to make the rankings more subjective instead of objective, all of the other polls are ranked according to sport's writers, coachs and others, while the BCS is comp[uter generated on stats from each of the teams. So that's the quickie version of it, as far as I know it anyway...hope it clears things up.

Has anyone ever heard of this new "sport"? Here is a blurb on it from the website: Geocaching is an entertaining adventure game for gps users. Participating in a cache hunt is a good way to take advantage of the wonderful features and capability of a gps unit. The basic idea is to have individuals and organizations set up caches all over the world and share the locations of these caches on the internet. GPS users can then use the location coordinates to find the caches. Once found, a cache may provide the visitor with a wide variety of rewards. All the visitor is asked to do is if they get something they should try to leave something for the cache. Anyway, I've stumbled upon this awhile back and I've always wanted to go get a GPS system to do this! It sounds like a lot of fun to me, a treasure hunt! They are all over the US and we could do it while we were traveling, or just take a weekend and do it around here. Check this out and let me know if you are interested, we could start doing this, great Christmas gift idea...

OK - so much has been going on lately - where to start? Well I spent the past 2 days running around with my 3 year old daughter Lauren. She had urlLink Nursemaids elbow and it was not fun! My poor little baby! She was hurting so bad. Monday night we were over at Grandmother's house (where we are every single day now, but that's another story...) and Patience (She's Grandmother's caregiver) was playing with Lauren and swinging her by the hands, we all do that with kids, right? Well, we shouldn't ever do that, especially with Lauren. So she gets her Nursemaids elbow and she is just miserable. We try to put it back into place, but with no luck. We take her home, give her plenty of Tylenol and Motrin and put her to bed. She slept so-so, kept waking up every time she rolled near that arm. So Tuesday morning then, I take her to the Pediatrician (The same pediatrician who told me that if I was a good mom I would take her out of daycare and stay home with her - yeah nice...I just haven't found a new pediatrician yet.) So they check out her arm and they are concerned it might be broke so they send me to the Medical Mall to go get X-rayed. So we do that, then go back to the Pediatrician and they review the pictures - nothing is wrong. They try again to put her arm back in place - still no luck. So we leave, they make an appointment for me to go see an Orthopedic Dr. because they are very concerned that she keeps getting this (she used to get it when she was very little, but hasn't had it in almost a year and a half). So I head into work to pick up my computer and some paperwork so I can work from home a bit - by the time we get into work, she's using her arm again and says it doesn't hurt anymore. I guess they got it back into place again that last time. CRAZY... So yesterday I leave work, pick her up and drive to the Orthopedic Dr. where I wait for 2 hours to get in and talk to him for about 3 minutes... Him: "Why did the pediatrician send you here?" Me: "They were concerned it kept happening so often with her." Him: "No, that's what happens - there's no treatment for this, she'll just grow out of it." Me: "*&^^$&(^#$$%@#" So I just wasted 2 hours and $25.00 - because my Pediatrician is a moron! Oh well, so I took Lauren to McDonald's for a sundae and then back to Daycare.... AUGH.

So over the Holiday's my friend Trish ended up battling with her bank and credit card companies - how lovely. I know how awful this is, almost the exact same thing happened to me last year. We were making monthly payments on a large bill, well apparently we were late one month - by 5 days - OH MY GOD! So as we are getting ready to finally start our Christmas shopping on December 20th (I know, but we are always late starting it...) we discover that the $1500.00 that we thought was in our bank account (from selling some stock that I had) was nowhere to be found. What possibly could have happened? We had absolutely no earthly idea...we didn't realize we were late on that payment. So after many calls we find out that the lawyers we were making payments to had seized all of our bank accounts and cleaned out everyone of them. They didn't even have to notify us of this happening, they sued us and didn't even tell us! Anyway, it all ended up fine and dandy - after many calls and what not, threats of more sueing blah, blah, blah...the lawyers finally sent us our money back. Of course, we didn't get it back until after Christmas - nice. So what can you do when stuff like this happens? Are you just stuck? Most importantly - How do you get revenge? Well here is urlLink one site that might be able to help with that. urlLink Another site to give you some ease...Anyway. I don't know the answer. All I know is that they can walk all over you without any trouble at all, they don't even have to tell you what they are doing. Very nice.

So....Steve's grandmother has been very sick - long story short: They found cancer, removed cancer, did radiation. Cancer is gone now, but the radiation just totally FRIED her brain. Nice. So she's slipping further and further into Alzheimers. She's just loosing it. So everyday now since about Thanksgiving we go over to her house. We spend nearly all of our free time there. She enjoys it - and we do too, most of the time. It has been very difficult sometimes to go there - but you know, you do what you have to do. So anyway, now her 2 daughters have decided to move her. I knew this day was coming - but it seems so quick - this Wednesday when Paula leaves to go back to Dallas, she will take Mothers with her. When I found that out, I just sat down and cried. It's the best thing for grandmother - I'm just being a bit selfish. I will miss her. My kids will miss her. Anyway, she'll live in Dallas with Paula until Connie, up in Ohio, is all set up and ready and then will move there. I don't think she quite gets it all - she thinks she's going for a visit, and will come back. She's worried about the house, but we keep telling her that Steve and I will be here to take care of it. So anyway...just needed to vent a bit. OK that's it for now....

SO, tomorrow I've got my mom, my sister-in-law and my 2 nephews coming for a visit. I'm so excited. They will be here tomorrow night around dinner time. They can't stay long - I think they are leaving Saturday late afternoon or so...Oh well. At least we get to visit for awhile. That will be fun. My house is trashed though...ugh. Shelly (my sister-in-law) keeps a perfect house - it's always clean! She's always up doing something in it, cleaning, painting, their house is beautiful! Well, mine will never be like that! But, that's OK. baby steps...at least we can walk through the house. It's fairly decent. One of my favorite sayings... "My kitchen floor used to be so clean you could eat a meal off of it - now you can find a whole meal on it." I love that one! I found that one off of my brother and Shelly - went on vacation and a lady they met used that line! How great! So I've stolen it and made it my own! I love it. Of course - my kitchen floor has NEVER been clean enough to eat off of...Oh well, sounds good anyway...

It was just absolutely gorgeous here! Saturday and Sunday - just wonderful. Saturday, I worked out in the front yard, planting more flowers. Steve worked on his car all day on Saturday - washing and waxing it. Trying to cover up some of the scratches and dents. Alex got invited to a movie with a friend, so he went to go see Scooby Doo 2 and then went to the park after that. That was soo cool. First time he's been invited on something like that. He's getting to that age now - I love it. He wants to have a couple of friends over and have a slumber party - I think we will try to do that in a few weeks. Should be fun! So anyway, I planted geraniums (red) all across the front porch and then some cilantro and basil at the corner. I also bought some more basil, cilantro and mint and planted that out in the "big" garden out front. Lauren wanted a pink flower so I bought some gerber daisies for her. Then I slept on the couch for about an hour....nice. Sunday, Steve went over and started on grandmother's pool early in the morning. I joined him soon and started working in the yard. I got the rose bed all weeded and started on the cactus garden. I hate working in the cactus garden - always get pricked! OUCH! So anyway, we worked out there for quite a bit, then I took the kids home. They were having an open house there and I didn't want the kids hanging out. Steve stayed and finished the pool. We ordered Outback for dinner - that was nice...mmmmm. I love Outback. We were so exhausted last night then, just went to bed and watched TV. We are sooo exciting! Anyway, got alot done this weekend and I feel good about it. I even got a bit of sun on my arms. Not so Casper looking now. Still very pale though...Oh well, what can you do? Hope everyone is having a good day! Talk to you later!

Anyone who really knows me, knows that I hate onions with a passion! I cannot stress enough - how much I dislike them. As I was growing up, my mom had to keep the onions, double bagged in a drawer in a dresser that was downstairs in the basement so that I didn't smell them. I cannot be around when someone is trying to cook with them. I mean the smell - UGH. I had a boyfriend once that did not understand how I really felt about onions - I warned him that they made me physically ill, he didn't believe me. So after eating a burger with big, thick slices of onion on it - he tried to kiss me - I threw up all over him. He understood after that. Now I know I am not urlLink alone.

So, I've not been having a good couple of days...I just cannot figure out how to shake this. We (my husband, and my kids and myself) are at the best point of our lives so far - everything is going so good! Yet I have this overall feeling of blah, sort of a depression, I'm not particularly sad - but I cry a lot. I feel tired, extremely tired and just cannot focus on all of the little things around me. I'm falling behind in work - never before...just don't get it. So I've been on Lexapro for about a month now, but I've also been taking sleeping pills with it. I'm thinking it's the sleeping pills that are hitting me hard now. I'm going to stop taking those for awhile and see if I don't improve. Keep your fingers crossed for me. Last night, I slept great without a sleeping pill and I feel so much better today. Yesterday, I was walking around like a zombie! So anyway...Maybe I am going crazy? Nah, I've been there already - that's not it. Oh well...Spring is here, and that always cheers me up. My flowers are starting to bloom in my yard - pretty tulips already! I love it. OK, that's a quick update - talk to you all later!

Well, we survived our 7 year old's birthday party at the skating rink! It turned out to be a very nice time. Alex had a blast and that's what is important. We had about 12 or 13 kids show up in total. That was a good turn out. Of course, Alex ignored the girls and they were all trying to get his attention. That was hilarious. He spent most of his time playing video games with the other boys. Good thing that I spent all of that money for the skating rink! haha. Next year I know - have his bday party at the video arcade, give each kid $20 bucks and I'll still be ahead! Anyway, it wasn't so bad yesterday. I may even do it again....We'll see. Another day survived. I came home and slept for about 2 hours after that - I was bushed. I even skated some while we were there, it's been a long time...but I didn't fall. My legs are sore today, I am soo out of shape. Oh well. Just wanted to let y'all know we had a good time.

Well, I've hit the big time - I'm posted as a Cliffhanger in another urlLink blog ...George from Panama. (I think it's Panama, anyway...) How funny! He's holding his breath to find out what happens today with Alex's bday party. As am I! I couldn't sleep all @$%(*& night. I just tossed and turned. What if 47 kids show up? (So far 3 have called to say they cannot come) Worse yet - what if no one shows up? God How terrifying is this whole birthday party thing? I don't want to EVER do it again. Of course, I'm sure I will be doing it all over again for my little 3 year old girl...Will I forget the pain of it all by then? We'll see.

Things just don't seem to slow down. So Saturday morning, got up early - set Alex in front of the electronic babysitter, Thank God for Cartoons. Then Lauren and I did a Sam's Club run. Those are usually tiring enough for me, but to do it with her was even more so. I got home just in time to get Alex in his ball uniform and out to the park for baseball tryouts. We got there and it ended up taking about 2 1/2 hours. Lauren does not like to sit still for that long, and there was really nothing for her to do. Meanwhile Steve is home in bed sound asleep. So we get home after his 5 minute tryout - he was in the last group! AUGH. Lauren's throwing a kicking and screaming fit, because now all of a sudden, she doesn't want to leave, she wants to stay there. So I'm dragging, literrally draggin her, through the parking lot to the car. Just keep on smiling! Get them home (we live about 3 minutes from the park) and then I give her a couple of good spankings - stung my hand! Throw her in bed to try to get some sleep. Alex and I played 3 games of Disney Yahtzee. That wore me out, then I went out back and weeded the flower beds there, then back inside to the couch with Lauren - she never did take a nap yet. So we both lay down on the couch and cover all up and then I put on her cartoons and we were both out within 5 minutes. Very nice. Just laid around the rest of the day. Sunday we didn't do too much, I planted some gladiola bulbs in the front, did a Walmart run, prepared the menu for dinners all this week. Something new I'm trying - preparing a menu for dinners a week at a time, that way I know I will have the food, we won't waste any of it, I can prepare some of it ahead of time...It's a really good theory. I'll let you know how it turns out. Anyway, went to bed early Sunday night - but just tossed and turned all night. I took my happy pill and my sleeping pill, but was still up all night. Finally about 3:00 am, I popped a couple of xanax and that helped. Of course now this morning I feel hung over. Can't win. I think I will switch to taking my happy pill in the morning, and just the sleeping pill at night. Maybe it's my Lexapro that is keeping me up. We'll give it a try anyway.

So Steve went out tonight with a friend. They just went to Happy Hour, now here it is almost 3:00am. He called at about 2 and said he was at the friends house and was just going to spend the night. I said "absolutely not" take a cab home if you can't drive. So now I'm up waiting on him cause I'm worried about him. I hate this feeling. I really don't mind if he goes out - he doesn't do it that often. When he said he was going, I just said "I'd rather if you don't stay out all night", he said he was just going for Happy hour and then would be home. He gets so mad at me if I stay out late. I hate this. Anyway, just a quick vent. Nothing really to be mad at - I'm just worried...

Steve: One dr. told him it was a urlLink herniated disk , but we are still not sure. He is going to see a back specialist now and she is telling him it sounds more like muscle spasms. We are waiting on the results of the MRI to come back. Lauren: She had urlLink strep throat and both ears infected. We are started her on anti-biotic right away, she seems to be getting better, although the way she acted you could hardly tell she was sick in the first place. Mom: She was experiencing some chest pains, and heart problems run VERY big in her family. So they checked her out thoroughly and she was fine. Not really sure what the problem was there. They have given her some sleeping pills to start taking, she had taken a sleep test too and apparently she never goes into a deep REM sleep, so she was tired all of the time. That may have helped cause the chest pains. Grandmother: She is living in Dallas now with her daughter Paula. We miss her very much. It's hard not seeing her all of the time. On one hand, what a relief not to "have" to go over there every single day to visit and take care of her, but on the other hand - we don't get to go visit her every day. We talk to her fairly often and she misses us a lot too. She doesn't understand why we don't come over for dinner like we used to do. That's hard. She seems more and more scattered too, I think the dementia is getting worse. Alex: He is great! He acts like a typical 6 year old, which is crazy, but he's a pretty good kid nonetheless. He's doing very good in school and getting all A's :). He is great with his sister and loves to play with her. His birthday is coming up - March 21st. He wants to have a party at the skating rink, you should see him skate, he's good! I can't believe he's going to be 7! WOW. Me: So it's going on 3 weeks now that I've been sick. YECH. First it was just a regular cold, then it turned into major congestion and a head cold. Then it moved down into my chest with the lingering cough. So finally I broke down and went to the Dr. about it. He said I have bronchitis and gave me some VERY strong cough syrup and an anti-biotic to start. Well, about 2 days into that I've developed strep throat. He said this anti-biotic should work on that too, but so far it's just gotten worse, I've been on the anti-biotic for 5 days now, and not much better. I think I'm going to give it another day or 2 and then go back to him and say FIX ME! I'm really tired of being sick. I've got no energy...blah. Also, right before I got sick, I went to the Dr. about some other things that were going on with me and he said that I have urlLink depression . So he put me on an anti-depressant called urlLink Lexapro . So there's that fun stuff too.

So here it is nearly 2 1/2 weeks later...I'm still sick. I just can't seem to kick this thing. I finally went to the Dr. on Saturday morning, and he really didn't have anything to tell me. Gave me an antibiotic prescription and some cough syrup to start on. The cough syrup though, has hydrocodone in it and that is just kicking my ass! Way too strong for me. My husband, on the other hand, loves it. So he can take it - I'm trying to find some other medicine. All of the cough drops I'm going through are giving me a terrible stomache ache. I think I'm going to go home early again today and try to get some rest and kick this a bit more. We'll see. I missed Friday at work because Lauren was sick, took her to the Dr. on Friday morning and she had a strep throat and both ears infected. Poor girl, you wouldn't even know she was sick though, she was bouncing around like crazy! What a nut! Anyway...I'm going to get some rest. I hope all of you feel well. Bye.

So I have just been so busy! And sick on top of it - AUGH! So it began on Friday the 20th - I woke up feeling horrible, I came into work but only lasted a half day and went home to sleep. I slept until Sunday morning, yeah I guess I needed some rest! Isn't that nuts? I mean, I barely budged those 2 days in bed, boy was that nice. So anyway, ran around a bit on Sunday (grocery shopping etc...). Then I needed to get ready to go down to Florida, I left on Tuesday afternoon to fly to Ft. Lauderdale for work. It was so beautiful down there! MAN was it nice - sunny and warm. I stayed at a really nice urlLink place too. It was right across from the beach. But anyway, I was down there for work, an urlLink ISO audit of our Sunrise facility - so I didn't really even get to enjoy the area or weather. I left there Thursday morning and flew to Cincinnati and then back to Huntsville, I was supposed to go through Atlanta but they got snow and the flights were all getting delayed and cancelled. So I worked all day on Friday trying to catch up from being gone - I can never catch up! Then I went home packed up our suitcases and the car just in time for Steve to arrive home with the kids and we got in the car and drove to Cincinnati (I know - I was just there yesterday!) So, I'm still sick, Lauren is starting to catch the cold and Steve went to the Doctor that morning and was told he had a urlLink herniated disk - this is going to be a fun drive! We were so exhausted, but we made it into my brothers house around 2:00 am local time. Got up early Saturday morning and getting ready to head up to Canton where we were going to spend the afternoon with my parents. So we call to tell them we are heading out and find out that they are just heading in to the emergency room with my mom. She had been having hot/cold flashes all night with chest pains. SOOO, now I'm really anxious to get up there. So when we get there we meet up with Dad in the parking lot. She's fine, she's just being monitored right now and the kids can't go in. I'll go back later and visit her by myself. So we go to lunch with Dad - that was really nice - went to The Irish Exchange out on Tusc. Had lunch and then went over to my in-laws. Which, this is the whole reason we were even making this crazy trip - they were having a party Saturday night for my Mother-in-law's 50th birthday. So everyone knew we were coming except for her. So we show up and surprise her - she was surprised, so that was fun. OK, so then the party Saturday night - it was out at urlLink Peter Shear's and was really nice! We had so much fun, the kids were good, just a great night. They are really fun people (my in-laws and their friends). They are a bunch of crazy people, for sure, it was fun! Naturally then Sunday morning I'm a bit hung-over, ugh, and still sick, ugh again. We get up early and round the kids up and head on to my parents house. Everyone at my in-laws is still sleeping soundly. Mom is home from the hospital, she got home really late Saturday night. She's excited to see the kids so she takes over and Steve and I go back to bed. (Catch a bit of sleep, not nearly enough.) So we just visit for awhile, then get back into the car and drive back to Cincinnati, I'm getting really tired of this drive. We get to my brother's and they are just firing up the grill for dinner. We have steaks and fish and it was all wonderful, everything. We're waiting on our friend Steve Youels to come over and visit for a bit. I'm about to fall over I'm so tired and I'm still hacking away from this cold. Steve doesn't even get there until 9:00, which is way past my bedtime, so I try to hang for awhile, but give up fairly soon and go to bed. Get up early Monday morning cause the kids are running around like mad animals. LOVE IT. Once again, we pack up our stuff and head out on the road to come home. The drive home was not too bad, we got in fairly early and had a chance to just kick back and rest. We ordered in Chinese for dinner and did not much else. So anyway, that pretty much brings me up to today. I'm still sick...I want to feel better...I know this was a really long read...sorry about that. And urlLink Trish - sorry we didn't even call you while we were in Canton! I meant to, just ran out of time. Anyway - I'll keep it shorter now that I'm all caught up...well mostly caught up!

Last night I was helping my 7 year old son do research on Tiger Sharks. All he had to do was write 5 measley sentences on Tiger Sharks! AUGH. So we are out there searching on the web. Lot's of sites - he can't come up with 5 little sentences... Me: Why don't you write what they look like? him: No, I already know that. Me: Well, maybe not everyone knows that... him: Yes, mom, everyone knows that - except for kindergartners - 'cause they don't read. Me: (sigh) Well, why don't you write what they eat. him: No, they just eat people and stuff... Me: (grinding teeth) So write that. him: No, I don't want to write that either... Me: (clenching jaw) You have to write something, what else are you going to write - WRITE SOMETHING NOW! So this just goes on and on...he ended up throwing down 5 quick sentences that I forced him to write because it was getting so late. This is what you other parents of little ones have to look forward to. Get used to the idea now. Besides that though, I did learn some interesting tidbits on Tiger Sharks. :)

So, it was around 1993. I was working at Chi-Chi's - Belden Village in Canton Ohio. This was an awesome place to work at the time! I was going to school full time at Kent State University, dating Steve, and having a blast! It was one of those places that everyone got along. We all hung out together, we worked together, we partied together and a lot of us slept together...but that's another story! Anyway...So, Tricia started working there - somewhere around '93 anyways...maybe a bit earlier...Well, she was friends with one of the "odd" girls. So, we really were not sure about her...watch what you say around her - cause we don't know what she is like yet! :) So, then Steve and I got engaged - that was December of 93. She had just gotten engaged as well and we were both starting to plan our weddings. That's when we became fast friends. We just clicked and hit it off from the start! There was actually 3 of us - Me, Trish and Susan. We were very close friends - but somehow - Trish and I were more alike...had more in common...I got married in '95 and at the time of my wedding, they were my best friends. Even though neither of them were in my wedding. How odd is that? Well, when we set the wedding and party and all of that - we really weren't hanging out. Then we did...but it was too late to change it. I remember on my wedding day - I was fine, not nervous at all...I walked into the back of the church holding my dad's arm - no prob! This was a piece of cake - then I turn the corner and the first people I see in the jam-packed church is Susan and Tricia - looking at me, smiling and a little teary eyed...I lost it. It just hit me so hard...I really had to grip on to my dad to make it up the aisle. So here we are 10+ years later and Tricia and I are still fast friends. She is surely one of those fair and foul weather friends. That's a great thing to know. Susan turned out to be a fair weather friend...but that's OK - a lot of people are like that. I don't keep in touch with any of my other friends from Ohio - I tried for a long time...but eventually just gave up. It was always a one way connection - they never tried to keep in touch with me. Oh well, again, you learn who your friends are. So, that's how I met Trish! Just a little bit of history...I don't know if any of you cared - but you know what? I don't care if you care! Again, I am only here to amuse myself! Thank you!

So we had a very nice Easter this year. This is the first Easter in about 7 years that we have actually had an Easter dinner! Very nice. I got up very early on Sunday morning and put together the easter baskets for the kids.... Lauren's: A cute little white basket filled with candy (not much), a plastic tea set, a jump rope, crayons, coloring book, a little stuffed easter bunny, urlLink silly putty , umm...what else? I guess that might be it - it was just all a bunch of small goodies from the dollar store (I love that place for things like this!) Alex's: A baseball duffel bag was his basket and it was filled with candy (again not much), a urlLink spirograph set , a silly pen with hair, colored markers, urlLink silly putty , a drawing book, construction paper, a water bottle and some hot wheels. Once I got them all put together, I put the baskets on the end of each of their beds - so they wake up to them. It's so fun hearing them wake up and start going through the stuff! I love it. So Alex comes running in to our room, where I'm pretending to be asleep, and yells "Mom, the Easter Bunny was here!!!" - he is so excited! I love it! Anyway it was fun. My parents were down here this weekend as well, so we just kind of hung out all day. It was rainy and wet - so there was no playing outside...I cooked a leg of lamb, a ham, mashed potatoes, corn, and we also had deviled eggs and a big salad. It was all so good! Really yummy. That was the first time that I've cooked lamb, it turned out wonderful. I bought all of the stuff to make gyros with the leftovers and made the gyro sauce too. That's what we will have for dinner tonight. I can't wait. MMMM. :) So Mom and Dad left this morning and headed back home to Ohio. I hope to get up to see them again soon. We'll see. Today is my 35th Bday - wow. Not much planned, going out to lunch with some girls from work. That will be nice...I guess that is it. Steve already got me my bday present (That digital camera). So that's all. Boy, as you get older, there is just less and less to look forward to! haha! Oh well, just another day.

So right now, Lauren is sleeping, Alex is drawing with chalk on the front walk and I am sitting outside talking to mom and dad. They got here late last night and we have just been hanging out visiting. I think we are going out to dinner tonight for my bday. (I turn 35 on Monday the 12th). Not sure where I want to go yet, we'll decide soon. Steve is over at Mother's house helping his parents with loading up some of that stuff. They are trying to pack up and head out soon - quick weekend for them. I wish I could go see them too, but my parents are here - what a busy weekend. So anyway...tomorrow, we'll have a nice little easter dinner and just kick back again, then my parents are leaving here Monday morning. It's been a nice day here, we've been working in the yard and cleaning up out front. Now I want to go buy my new front porch funiture, not sure if we have enough money though....guess I'll wait. So anyway...just wanted to say hi. I'll holler at y'all later! Hope everyone is having a good day! Bye!

Here's one I got today - thought was funny...again, I am only here to amuse myself! A drunken man walks into a biker bar, sits down at the bar and orders a drink. Looking around, he sees 3 men sitting at a corner table. He gets up, staggers to the table, leans over, looks the biggest, meanest, biker in the face and says: I went by your grandma's house today and I saw her in the hallway buck naked. Man, she is one fine looking woman!" The biker looks at him and doesn't say a word. His buddies are confused, because he is one bad biker and would fight at the drop of a hat. The drunk leans on the table again and says: "I got it on with your grandma and she is good, the best I ever had!" The biker's buddies are starting to get really mad but the biker still says nothing. The drunk leans on the! table one more time and says, "I'll tell you something else, boy, your grandma liked it!" At this point the biker stands up, takes the drunk by the shoulders looks him square in the eyes and says, "Grandpa,....... Go home, you're drunk !"

In the year of 2004 I hereby resolve.... ...to be a more positive and optimistic person. ( This one will be tough, but, I will try...) Yeah - well I knew this one was going to be hard...I think I'm better... ...to keep my weight down. I am playing with them a lot more! ...spend more one on one time with my husband! ;) Definitely doing that! ...write letters to my family and friends far away. no letters yet...I need to move on that! ...be more organized! Last night Alex had baseball practice. We hadn't been there for very long, I had just started reading my book (The portrait of Dorian Gray) when I hear this loud thud...uh oh - I look up and all of the coaches take off running to Alex. He had turned to catch the ball - but the sun was right in his eyes and he lost it. It nailed him right in his nose - blood was just ouring out of his nose like someone had turned a faucet on. Oh boy, so they bring him over to the bleachers and sit him down - boy it was hard to get that blood to stop pouring. It just kept on coming. I finally got it slowed down and put some ice on his nose - poor kid- he was just bawling the whole time - "this is why I don't want to play baseball!". So after I get him calmed down and cleaned up some, I just took him home. He's OK, but he does have a mark under his nose from the stitched on the baseball....poor kid...

Another monday. This weekend flew by fast and furious. My family got in Thursday evening, it was a great visit with them. I wish I could see them more often. But anyways, it was fun. They stayed until Saturday afternoon and took off around 2:30 or 3:00. Lauren went with my mom - (yeah!). My mom and dad are coming back down here on Friday the 9th, they'll spend the weekend and bring Lauren back. It was so quiet here on Sunday without that girl. I just layed around all afternoon - wonderful. It was too cold outside to do much of anything anyway. So I just watched movies. So this morning, we're running late for work because we overslept...go figure. I just could not drag myself out of bed this morning! So, we're getting in a big rush - I tell Steve - "go ahead in, I'll take Alex and then come in." No sooner had he left, then I realize I cannot find my car keys. They are nowhere. I'm tearing everything apart looking for them. I'm suspecting that they fell out of my purse in his car. Well, he doesn't have a cell phone, so I have to wait until he gets all of the way into work to find out. So, after a few calls, he goes out to his car...sure enough - there they are. Now I need to wait on him to come all the way back home to give me my keys. What a pain in the ass! MAN. Then I need to go get gas right away because my car is way past E. Run Alex to school, he's so late, I have to go in and sign for him and take him to his class. So, by the time I get to work it is now 9:45. Most of the morning gone...Now, I'm trying to catch up again - as always. So, no workout today - no lunch today - work late. Actually I have a dinner tonight. One of my sales reps is in town from New Hampshire, so a few of us are going out with her. Should be fun. Not sure where we are going yet....OK - got to get to work then. Hope everyone else is having a good day! Talk to you later...

OK - don't have much time, but wanted to let everyone know that I finally got back the results from my MRI. They were negative, they didn't find anything there that would be causing my vertigo. So, I guess that is good - but that means that I still do not have a reason as to what could be causing this DAMN Vertigo! So, most likely it is some kind of infection that we are just not seeing. OK, got to get back to work, just thought you might be interested in knowing...then again, you may not! I don't care! haha! :)

OK - here's the plan... Friday - we leave here right after work and hit the road, head to Cinci and spend the night at my brother's house (about 7 hour drive). So anyway - maybe on Monday to see them...I think. I want to see Trish at some point too and have some drinks or coffee with her. Tuesday - after lunch, head back to Cinci. I want to see you - we must get together up there! We are going to try to spend some time with everyone. We'll see...

Alrighty then, just a quick update to tell you that I do not yet know the results of my MRI. I went in Friday and had it done, believe it or not, it was not a lot of fun. Crazy, huh? So I lay down on this flat 'bed' and they pack my head in with these stiff pillows so that I will not move around. Then they drop a 'cage' over my head...hmmm...wasn't expecting that. So, I slowly start moving into the tube and my thought is "well, this is just like going into a coffin" - not a good thought, I can see why some people get anxious in these things - "yes, it's very tight in here" - hmm...having a hard time breathing, is this thing closing in on me..??? OK - focus on breathing just relax...listen to the LOUD noised...OK, calming down. After the initial bit, it was fine - almost got to the point where I could go to sleep, if they hadn't of given me that ice cold shot half way through - brrr. Anyway, I'm going to wait til after lunch and give the dr's office a call if I hadn't heard from them by then. Which I'm sure I won't. You know how dr's work. On one hand I want the Dr. to say - "yes - we see what is causing your vertigo" so I will know what it is and we can treat it. On the other hand, I don't want them to see anything in that MRI...make sense? I'm sure you understand. Well, we just have to wait and see in any case. So, just wanted to give you an update, there you go!

Blogspot rules! I'm now able to post photos on my blog! Woo Hoo! I am so excited...the possibilities are endless! Anyway, my first test worked...on to bigger and better things (well, not that you could get better than those darlings!)

Well, I now have a 2nd grader at home! I can't believe it! Alex is 7 already - how time flies! WOW. Anyway, yesterday was his last day of school. He ended up with all A's! I know, some of you are saying - well - sure, it's only 1st grade, he better have all A's. But that is not always the case - it's not like his whole class finished that well. So - I am extremely proud of him! As a special reward for him doing so well - we stopped off and bought him an urlLink aquarium and a couple of little fish. We got 6 urlLink neon tetra's , 1 male urlLink guppy , 2 female urlLink guppies , an urlLink algae eater and a urlLink shrimp . The shrimp got in the bag by accident, so that one will be Lauren's. She has named it Rex. Nice, huh? Oh well. Anyway...so we get up this morning and one of the little tetra's is dead already... Me: Well, Alex - we lost one of your tetra's already honey. Alex: How did we lose him - didn't we put them all in the tank? Me: Yes, but one of them died overnight. Alex: Where is he? Me: He is in the plant, mommy will have to pull him out of the tank this morning. So, a few minutes go by, we are all getting dressed, and I walk by his room to see him sitting on the edge of the bed, near tears. Me: What's wrong honey? ALex: I know why the fish died...you told me not to put my finger in the water and while you weren't looking last night, I did... Me: *hug* Oh honey - that didn't kill the fish! You should never put your finger in the water - but still that wouldn't kill the fish! Alex: Are you sure that I didn't kill the fish - I went and looked at him and his face is all white. Anyway - how pitiful is that? I went on to do my best by explaining that the fish was probably either already sick or just didn't like the new water...I think he was OK with it all by the end! I think...of course I still had to pull that fish out of the water...ick. Oh well! Got to run! Have a great day everyone!

I learned yesterday, that you could light urlLink C-4 on fire and it would not blow up. You can use it to cook with off in the jungles of Thailand (say for instance a monkey that you just shot), just don't stomp that fire out - that would be the last time you did that! Apparently what causes it to actually blow up is the shock. So it needs both fire and shock to explode. I did not realize this! See you really do learn something new each day! I hope I could share a small bit of this wisdom with all of you!

What do you mean Tricia? How bad can a MRI be? I think I may have had one done a long time ago...but don't really remember - that may have been a CAT scan. Anyway, I figure the worst part will be getting the IV done. I HATE needles - terrified of shots! An irrational fear, but a big fear nonetheless! So now, you have me wondering...How bad will it be? Well, one thing is certain - I will find out tomorrow! I am rather anxious to have it done because I really want to see what is causing this vertigo and I hope they find in explanation in doing this MRI. He feels that it could be one of several things...a deep down sinus infection that is just not seen by looking in my ears, or nose, or eyes...a growth on the inner ear canal (he called it something, but I don't remember what)...a tumor (he said, very small chance...nervous haha). I did ask him about the vertabrae, trish, he said he didn't think that would really cause Vertigo. Not to offend you or what you are doing - but he said "That probably came from a Chiropractor - and that is just really not medically founded - he's probably got her on some kind of herb or mineral too." SOOO...not sure, but that's what he said. Obviously though, your treatments seem to be working for you. Well OK then, that's what is up there. I'm back to our ISO Audit all day today, so I will be out of pocket. Hope everyone has a great day and I will write to you more later.

So much is going on right now around our country and around our world...it's hard sometimes to just get through the day. I normally don't go on about politics and world affairs - I guess I try to leave that to the "brillant" minds out there. I try to add a bit of my life, a bit of lightness to the world...when I can anyway. Sometimes it does get difficult. I guess, I struggle within myself on how I feel about some of these "heavier" issues and the reality of it is - We NEVER know the whole story. The war in Iraq, the prisoner abuse scandal, the beheading of an American...I mean - we only are getting half the story, and that's all we will get. The Kobe Bryant rape case, the Scott Peterson trial...we only know part of the story! I try to be an optimist - maybe I'm just naive. I don't know. Anyway - not sure that I really have a point at all to the post, sorry about my rambling. I just get depressed sometimes about the situation of the world...especially since I have become a mom - I just want the best for my kids - of course. But then, I look at what my kids see - and I think that right now, they think the world is a pretty good place. From their point of view - Life is great! That makes me feel good, that means that I am doing my job right for now anyway! Well - ok all - have a good day - I'll post more later!

OK...so I'm walking around here at work, dropping off some paperwork and whatnot...still in an awesome mood...I stop to talk to another girl for a bit in the hall and she says "Are you pregnant?"...... Me (sob) no, I just gained some weight at my party this weekend - too much beer and junk food...(Big Sigh...) Her "oh" WTF is that about? God - how much more depressing can it get? I did gain about 6 lbs in this past week. Not Good. OK got to get back to the gym and urlLink watching my weight . I've been watching what I eat this week, but still haven't been back in to the gym due to my vertigo. NICE. Well, just thought I would share that with you. My ongoing weight struggle continues! When will it cease? When will I be a urlLink MILF ? This is a major part of my depression - why does ones weight carry such a large burden? :( Do I need to take an extra urlLink happy pill today? Do I need to just sit in a corner and sob...what to do - what to do...I guess the better answer would be to have a healthy salad for lunch and get some exercise today! That sounds about right...I guess...OK, till later...hope everyone else is having a better day...

So I went in to the Dr. today....still no reason as to why I have urlLink Vertigo . He believes I have some Viral infection that is causing it. So he gave me new meds to try and see if they work. So I will give them a try, we'll see...keep your fingers crossed. He also said that I need to be very inactive - moving around alot will aggravate it. How do I do that with a full time job, a husband and 2 kids? Hmm...that would be a good trick. So anyway, one of the meds he gave me is urlLink Xanax , which is a tranquilizer - he said this will help to "force" me to slow down. Interesting...we'll see....of course, now I may be a zombie here at work. I guess it's better than banging and bumping into all of the walls...Hmmm. Oh well, I will keep you updated!

"There's nothing in there!" haha! No - he believes that what I'm experiencing is due to allergies and it's not something that can really be easily treated. He says that it will most likely go away when the pollen count goes down. The best way to treat it is with Xanax, 2-3 times a day. We'll see if I can function on that! haha! He also did some blood work, so we'll see if anything comes of that either. I have noticed that the past few days, when it's been raining heavily here, my vertigo has been almost non-existent. So the allergy thing does make some sense. Anyway...we'll watch it and see. Just wanted to update y'all!

If we could shrink the earth's population to a village of precisely 100 people, with all the existing human ratios remaining the same, it would look something like the following: There would be: 57 Asians 21 Europeans 14 from the Western Hemisphere, both north and south, 8 Africans. 52 would be female 48 would be male. 70 would be non white 30 would be white. 70 would be non-Christian 30 would be non Christian. 89 would be heterosexual 11 would be homosexual. 6 people would possess 59% of the entire world's wealth and all 6 would be from the United States. 80 would live in substandard housing. 70 would be unable to read 50 would suffer from malnutrition. 1 would be near death; 1 would be near birth. 1 (yes, only 1) would have college education. 1 would own a computer. urlLink When one considers our world from such a compressed perspective, the need for acceptance, understanding and education becomes glaringly apparent.

Something I ran across and I really like... - Give people more than they expect and do it cheerfully. - Marry a man/woman you love to talk to. As you get older, their conversational skills will be as important as any other. - Don't believe all you hear, spend all you have or sleep all you want. - When you say, "I love you," mean it. - When you say, "I'm sorry," look the person in the eye. - Be engaged at least six months before you get married. - Believe in love at first sight. - Never laugh at anyone's dreams. People who don't have dreams don't have much. - Love deeply and passionately. You might get hurt but it's the only way to live life completely. - In disagreements, fight fairly. No name calling. - Don't judge people by their relatives. - Talk slowly but think quickly. - When someone asks you a question you don't want to answer, smile and ask, "Why do you want to know?" - Remember that great love and great achievements involve great risk. - Say "bless you" when you hear someone sneeze. - When you lose, don't lose the lesson. - Remember the three R's: Respect for self; Respect for others; and responsibility for all your actions. - Don't let a little dispute injure a great friendship. - When you realize you've made a mistake, take immediate steps to correct it. - Smile when picking up the phone. The caller will hear it in your voice. - Spend some time alone.

Well I did the test yesterday - not a lot of fun, but it wasn't as bad as I was expecting either. So now I am just waiting on the results of the exam - I should hear something this morning - I hope. My feeling is, I'll get a big fat negative AGAIN and still not know what the hell is going on with this vertigo. But, I guess I should be more optimistic. I am having a very hard time with this stuff. I am getting very stressed out over it, and even more frustrated. I'm trying not to let it get me down, because after all - it could be so much worse. There are people out there having to deal with so many things that are so much more difficult. Still...I don't know, it's just not the easiest thing to deal with. But, life goes on. I guess. OK - sorry about being such a downer this morning... Life's a bitch though ain't it?

I really hate that feeling, I wish they could figure out what is going on with me - I'm not liking this at all. Then I also had a HUGE anxiety attack on top of it all. Nice, huh? I just can't take the noise - the kids, the hubby, the tv, the dishwasher, the washing machine, the air conditioning running - all of it just seemed to be BLARING in my head and I just couldn't take it - so I BLEW up - just literally blew up on hubby and was ready to walk out the door. Hope that I could shed a bit of light for you Trish...here you go. urlLink Trish writes: Really? Good! I really need the answers to the following: - Do the actors on Unsolved Mysteries ever get arrested because they look just like the criminal they are playing? Yeah - well, not really - in fact quite often the actors have absolutely no resemblance at all to the real criminal, most likely this is to keep this from happening in the first place. - What if you were to ask a genie to grant you more than three wishes for one of you wishes? That calls for immediate disqualification and the genie will then revoke all wishes. This is a good, but hard way to learn not to be greedy. - Why is it that when adults have multiple personalities it's schizophrenia, but when a child has imaginary friends it's cute? Well - in my opinion, it's just a bit freaky no matter what age you are. I mean really a kid talking to an invisible friend is NOT right, that is just plain weird...the stuff that horror movies are made from! An adult talking to an invisible friend well - just stay away from them. Not to be confused with an adult talking to themselves however - that's fine. - When people say, "Iâm so tired it's not even funny" or "my head hurts so much it's not even funny", why would it even be funny in the first place? You have no sense of humor...I mean really, think about it - just a slight headache - Freaking hilarious! God, makes me chuckle now just thinking about it...hehehe...and the tired part! WOW - now that is humor! But as in all things, there is a fine line...when you get too much of a good thing, well you know - that will generally spoil it. Then it is just not funny anymore. - Are children who act in rated 'R' movies allowed to see them? Absolutely not, this little law is strictly adhered to. They are allowed to see their own shots - but not in order, so they don't even know what the movie is about sometimes. Now, however, if it is an R movie they will be allowed to come see it as long as they are accompanied by a parent or an adult guardian - if it is an NC-17 movie - no way jose! - When French people swear do they say pardon my English? Some English-speakers stereotype the French as permissive about anything risquÃ©. This was particularly true a hundred years ago when the phrase took off as an "apology" for swearing. "Excuse my French" or "Pardon my French" isn't just play-acting that you're speaking a foreign language. It's also a bit like saying, "I know those words are naughty - but maybe I could get away with behaving like that in France, where people are more tolerant of obscenity." So, NO, the french do not say that.

Yeah! It was so exciting to see them come through the security gates at the airport last night. As soon as they saw us, they came running. What a wonderful feeling - they both looked so different! They must have grown a foot this past 2 weeks! Well, ok maybe not a foot, they only had the 2 they left with. But they have grown some! Anyway, I let them sleep in this morning and then hung out with them a bit this morning before coming into work. Lauren screamed like a freaking banchee then when I took her into daycare...always fun. She just didn't want to leave her mommy. I can't blame her. Anyway, thrilled to have my nerds back home! YEAH! Of course, that does stop the crazy wild sex from hubby and I in the living room...well...we'll just put a movie in for the kids...

Shwew...I'm worn out! Really! So...Friday night the adventure began, we left work and went on the Gallery Tour, we only hit 2 galleries, but they were both very nice, and interesting. Then we decided we were hungry...so we went to my favorite restaurant..mmmmm.... urlLink 801 Franklin So good! We just ended up hanging out there at the bar all night then and didn't leave until we were ready to go home. It's just always so nice there, great atmosphere, wonderful food and terriffic wine. Saturday we woke up early and the power was out. So, since we couldn't make coffee - we went out for breakfast at Victoria's - killer breakfast there. Boy, can they make an omelot! We went back home to start cleaning the house, but the power was still out - and you really can't clean the house with no power, you know? So- we decided to go shopping for tents. We need to buy one, because we are going camping in 2 weeks. So we went running around looking, well we did find one we liked... urlLink this one . We didn't buy it yet though...on Friday. We just ran around all day on Sat. going from one store to the next, buying odds and ends...things we needed around the house and what-not. Very nice afternoon...even stopped off at an Adult store...but I'll leave that story between steve and I! LOL! Then Sat. night we rented some movies and just sat back and watched them...Along came Polly, and The Bourne Identity. Well, we watched the Bourne identity - haven't seen polly yet. Sunday we woke up early and got ready for another outing...headed up to a friends house and met a bunch of people we work with to go canoeing. Well, we were just going to go for 3-4 hours, but when we finished that...it was so much fun, we just kept on going down the river. So the driver just arranged to come pick us up at the end, at 8:00 pm - long day...but a fun day, really fun day. I drank so much on the first half, that I was already getting a hangover on the second half...ugh...nothing worse than getting a hangover on the same day! At the end, we just went home and crashed! So - what a weekend...it was a busy one, and a good one. The last one without the kids...hmmm...so we drive up to Nashville tonight to get the brats. They are coming in with my father-in-law at 10:00 pm. Late night. But that's OK, can't wait to see them. I'm getting real excited now, to get them back. Can't wait. OK all - hope you have a great day and i'll chat to you more later....

Last weekend before the kids come home so hubby and I are very busy! Lots to do, not much time...we are getting ready to go out to a Gallery Tour tonight, have a party tomorrow night and canoeing on Sunday...So if you don't hear from me all weekend...you know why! Hope everyone has a great one..we will! Bye!

She has both of my kids this week and they are going nuts! Lauren is crying all of the time, being a brat and picking on her big brother. Alex is hitting her back, and just not listening! They are a lot to handle and my poor mother is not used to this...I feel so bad for her. I know that her and dad are certainly enjoying this time with the kids, but I also know how difficult it is for them. I mean - all I want is for my kids to behave with others, it should be simple. I believe that we are teaching and showing them proper manners, but then....I just never see it. Anyway...so my kids are brats and they are being terrible to my mom... I'm sorry mom, you always told me that you hoped I would get kids just like me...guess not though, these ones are bad...I know that I wasn't.
I try to take one day at a time, but sometimes several days attack me at once.

Lots going on....Kids are still gone...(so sad - NOT!) No really, I do miss them a bit, but I am having such a blast without them too. This has been really great, and well needed for Steve and I. We have had a terrific time so far, a week still to go. Kids are having a great time up in Ohio...I think wearing my mom and dad out though! They will be glad to see them go this time! ha-ha! So what else...well....working on our kitchen finally...trying to tear all of the wallpaper off...having a #^$^%$&@ of a time doing it. Oh well, when we get that done we are just plastering and painting the walls. Should look good. We'll see. Sunday, Steve and I went out boating with some friends. WOW, that was fun. I hadn't been out in awhile, well deserved break. We were out there all day, water skiing, tubing, swimming, eating and drinking. Just wiped me out...and I got burnt too. I need ALOE...ooohhhhh. I kept trying to put lotion on, obviously didn't do it enough though...Oh well. It's not all that bad. I will Survive. (OH - awesome disco song...i will survive...I'm going to be singing that the rest of the day now...) Anyway...tonight we are grocery shopping and doing laundry. We need to work on the kitchen some more as well, but we are both too tired and sore for that. We'll get to it later...yeah - right!

Be alert to this one.... I hate people that forward those phony hoax warnings as much as anyone, but this one is important! Send this warning to everyone on your e-mail list! If someone comes to your front door saying they are conducting a survey on deer ticks and asks you to take your clothes off, do not do it. IT IS A SCAM; they only want to see you naked. I wish I'd gotten this yesterday. I feel so stupid and cheap now.

He jumps up to see who is there, it's our neighbor - just coming back from Egypt and he brought me a necklace that I had asked for - when Steve opens the door, our neighbor just leans in, gives Steve a big hug and pat on the back and says "I love you man". A bus carrying only ugly people crashes into an oncoming truck, and everyone inside dies. They then get to meet their maker, and because of the grief they have experienced; he decides to grant them one wish each, before they enter Paradise. They're all lined up, and God asks the first one what the wish is. "I want to be gorgeous," and so God snaps His fingers, and it is done. The second one in line hears this and says, "I want to be gorgeous too." Another snap of His fingers and the wish is granted. This goes on for a while with each one asking to be gorgeous but when God is halfway down the line, the last guy in the line starts laughing. When there are only ten people left, this guy is rolling on the floor, laughing his head off. Finally, God reaches this last guy and asks him what his wish will be. The guy eventually calms down and says: "Make 'em all ugly again".
I need some interaction here....is anyone out there? Talk to me!

So, I've finally done it. I've signed up for an oil painting class at the Art Museum. It starts this Saturday morning. I can't wait to get into it again. It's been years, well since I've graduated college, since I've painted. Can I still do it? Will I remember all that I have learned? Well...it really doesn't matter, I'm just so psyched about getting back into it. REALLY. Ah, the masterpieces that I will be churning out...don't worry - I will share them with all of you, my faithful disciples.

Yes, there is always something going on in this family...So...Alex developed a bladder infection like a week ago or so, he's over it now and all fine. He was never actually bad - it just bothered him a little bit. Anyway...so now we need to look into it, because apparently it is not common for children to get bladder infections, and even less common for young boys to get bladder infections....of course. So we went to the Urologist yesterday, he ran a few tests - did an ultrasound. He said everything looks pretty normal - it could be nothing, but it looks like there is a cyst on his kidney. Hmmm...OK - a cyst, not so bad...lots of people have cysts right? No biggie...well, it's a cyst on the kidney of MY BABY though! If the Dr. had told me I had a cyst, it wouldn't have been a big deal at all...but for my boy to have one...now I'm just freaking out! Yeah - I guess that's what mom's do. So anyway, we go in again today to have another ultrasound done at another place and check it out a bit further. So we shall see how that turns out and I will indeed keep you updated... I told him after the ultrasound today we will go do his school shopping. We have to get all of his school supplies and some new clothes for school as well, he is growing like a WEED! LOL!

I'm stealing this from urlLink Birdie ...that's urlLink Murph's Blog-o-licious hubby...I just thought it looked interesting and gives you a chance to get to know me. Please fill it out yourself and reply to me with it! I would love to learn about you too! The theory is that you will learn a lot more about your friends. 1. What time do you get up in the morning? Usually between 6:00 and 6:30 a.m. 2. If you could eat lunch with one living person who would it be? Hmmm....good one, well - let's see....a living person...I think that I would love to have lunch with Katie Couric - she seems like a real interesting woman. 3. Gold or Silver? Definitely silver - of course. 4. What was the last film you saw at the cinema? Spiderman 2. 5. What is/are your favourite TV Shows? I love the CSI shows - all of them, Miami and Las Vegas - the Navy one too, can't wait for the New York one... 6. What did you have for breakfast? This morning I had 2 cups of coffee and ....well that's it... 7. Who would you hate to be stuck in a room with? OH - MAN...another tough one...but really, no one specifically - just would hate getting stuck in a room with a person who is dirty and smells, hadn't taken a shower in days...ugh... 8. What is your middle name? Lynn 9. Beach, City, Country, or Mountains? Mountains! 10. Favourite Ice Cream? Pistachio Walnut 11. Butter, Plain or Salted popcorn? Extra butter, extra salt. 12. Favourite Colours? Black and red. 13. What kind of car do you drive? 2002 Chevy Malibu. 14. Favourite sandwich? Peanut Butter, mayonnaise and pickles 15. Who do you despise? Those "holier-than-thou" religious freaks! If you are going to preach it, you better live it!! 16. Favourite flower? Lilacs. 17. If you could go anywhere on vacation, where would you go? Right now the top of my list is Greece. 18. What colour is your bathroom? Kind of a taupe and lavender. 19. Favourite brand of clothing? Brand? Whatever is at the thrift store that day... 20. Where would you retire? Not sure that I could pick one place, I'd like to travel all over during my retirement...see the world. 21. Favourite day of the week? SATURDAY! 22. What did you do for your last birthday? I don't remember...think that hubby and the kids took me out to eat...that's all... 23. Where were you born? In a hospital. 24. Favourite sport to watch on TV? If I have to watch a sport on TV then it's college football... 25. Who do you least expect to send this back to you? answer in the comments? Well - don't expect it back from anyone...since I'm just posting it - not sending it out... 26. Person you expect to send back answer first? Hello? didn't you hear what I just said. 27. What fabric detergent do you use? The cheapest one at Sam's Club...yes, I'm what you call "thrifty". 28. Coke or Pepsi? Definitely Pepsi...coke is WAY too sweet, but I prefer diet anyway... 29. Are you a morning person or a night owl? Morning person - can't hang very late... 30. What is your shoe size? I wear a size 7 shoe. 31. Do you have any pets? We have some fish - 2 female guppies, a baby guppy and an algae eater. 32. Who sent this to you? Stole it from Birdie. 33. Bacon or sausage? Sausage links. 34. What booze do you choose? Tequila - love me a margarita! 35. Done any jail time? NEVER! 36. Are you gay? As in happy? Sure!

Boy did we have a blast up there! We camped out all weekend in Cave City, KY - Mammoth Caves. It was real fun. We got bad thunderstorms Friday night, but it was beautiful the rest of the weekend. Kids had a blast, and the adults did too! I was worn out, really just beat after it was all said and done, but it was a good tired! We went through the caverns on Sunday morning and that was really interesting. It was a 2 hour hike through the caves - about 2 miles and it was cold in there! We were prepared for it, thank goodness, so we stayed fairly warm. Then we got back outside where it was just roasting hot and very humid. Headed back home Sunday night after stopping for dinner and ice cream. We ate SO much this weekend...food, food, food - my kind of camping trip! All of the great camping food, cooked out over an open fire - YUM! So, now I need to watch what I eat again and work this off! Oh well, it was worth it. Anyway, we are definitely planning on doing this again, it was just So much fun! It was a good place too, almost exactly halfway in between us and my brother's in Cinci. - worked out well. There was lots to do around there and we didn't do much of it....so next time we'll do more! This trip comes highly recommended!
